625fb358-c64e-48fe-941e-a2ba49f0021d.title: Linear Programming

So, this week we will look at some general 
powerful techniques for solving problems that can   be applied to a large variety of questions that we 
need to answer. So, the first of these is called   linear programming. So, a number of the questions 
that w

e have asked in our algorithms course   have involved optimization. 
So, remember when we started with graphs   with weighted graphs, we were 
looking for shortest paths,   then later on we were looking for spanning trees 
with a minimum cost, then when we

4307e93b-18b2-40db-9617-a3be1ec75958.title: Linear Programming
4307e93b-18b2-40db-9617-a3be1ec75958.chunk:
were doing   dynamic programming, we looked at subsequence 
s that were common to two words and we wanted   the longest such common subsequence. 
So, in each case we are looking for some   optimal value, either the shortest the 
smallest or the largest or

760afb41-0f0e-4d17-82e4-e323fb178780.chunk:
the longest.   And of course, these values have to be found 
within some constraints for instance, the shortest   path between two nodes in a weighted graph must 
of course follow the edges that are given to us,   so we are given some edges and among thos

4e9477f4-3ee4-4147-a141-fcc81c59a601.title: Linear Programming
4e9477f4-3ee4-4147-a141-fcc81c59a601.chunk:
e 
edges we have to construct the shortest path.
  In the same way, when we want to build a minimum 
cost spanning tree, the spanning tree edges must   come from the edges that we already have. We 
cannot construct new edges to make a spanning tree   and o

97e80677-78ca-43d9-bee0-9b2a0649b4fe.title: Linear Programming
97e80677-78ca-43d9-bee0-9b2a0649b4fe.chunk:
f course when we find the longest common 
subsequence, we are looking for letters which   occur in the same order in both the words that are 
given to us, so we cannot shuffle the order. 
  So, linear programming is a 
general class of problems which   fol

095719a4-e90c-49cf-ba5d-8c63c9200a7a.title: Linear Programming
095719a4-e90c-49cf-ba5d-8c63c9200a7a.chunk:
low a similar paradigm where we are trying to 
optimize some value subject to some constraints.   The reason that this is called linear is because 
these constraints are given to us numerically   in terms of linear functions. So, you know that 
a linear fu

f2b7f1bc-7c07-4da6-9967-eec9445fb672.title: Linear Programming
f2b7f1bc-7c07-4da6-9967-eec9445fb672.chunk:
nction is something where you have   a variable multiplied by a constant but you do 
not have variables multiplied by each other. 
  So, you cannot write x square or x times y 
but you can write xy and so on. So, supposing   we have input variables x1 to x

e9f0923b-b48a-4e21-b97f-6009e74c9804.title: Linear Programming
e9f0923b-b48a-4e21-b97f-6009e74c9804.chunk:
m, then a linear 
constraint would be of this form, it will say some   linear combination, so we have coefficients ai 
and the variables xi. So, some combination ai, xi   of our variables added up together is either 
below some value or above some value. S

bfdd609e-1e41-4edd-b92b-0d434edc32f9.title: Linear Programming
bfdd609e-1e41-4edd-b92b-0d434edc32f9.chunk:
o,   the constraint could be a maximum constraint 
it can be that it can be no more than something   or it can be no less than something. 
And finally subject to these constraints we   have to optimize. So, the optimization is given 
in terms of some quant

b7c01765-88ff-4fdc-8ee5-b7ec2387d9e1.title: Linear Programming
b7c01765-88ff-4fdc-8ee5-b7ec2387d9e1.chunk:
ity of these variables.   So, this is typically written as an 
objective which is another linear function.   Now notice that some of these coefficients 
could be 0, so it could be that xj does not   contribute to the to the overall optimum at 
all, in whic

9f1a4510-45eb-4a31-b68e-68fdbd4881ff.title: Linear Programming
9f1a4510-45eb-4a31-b68e-68fdbd4881ff.chunk:
h case in this cost function or   this objective function cj might just be 0. 
But this is the general form, we have these linear   constraints and then we have a linear function 
which tells us what we are trying to optimize   maximize or minimize and now

1d008994-047c-4afb-8feb-f0d7d5464342.title: Linear Programming
1d008994-047c-4afb-8feb-f0d7d5464342.chunk:
we have to find the 
optimum values for this x1 to xm, subject to these   constraints which optimizes that objective. 
So, let us look at an example. So, grandiose   sweets is a sweet shop that sells two types 
of sweets, cashew barfis and dry fruit halwa

.   So, there is a profit associated 
with selling each of these.   For each box of barfis the shop makes rupees 100. 
For each box of halwa the shop earns rupees 600.   Now the daily demand is known they know that 
the no more than 200 boxes of barfis wil

l be   sold in any given day and no more than 300 boxes 
of halwa will be given sold in any given day.

about how many boxes they can produce? So,   the staff of the shop working throughout the day 
can produce at

most 400 boxes, these boxes can be   either barfi or halwa. So, now we are given these

should market every day so it maximizes profit?
  So, to use linear p

rogramming we have to 
set up those linear constraints and the   linear objective as we said. So, first we 
need to identify what the variables are?   So, here it is very clear that the 
variables are how many barfis we produce   and how many halwas we pro

1f0211df-1eb6-4ac9-9fdc-ac55539470f1.title: Linear Programming
1f0211df-1eb6-4ac9-9fdc-ac55539470f1.chunk:
duce or how many

number of boxes of halwa, this should be halwa,

that we want to produce each day.

and h boxes of halwa, then the profit will be   100 for each of the b boxes and 600 for each of 
the halwa boxes so we will get 100 b

e22a047d-4a26-461e-a6c0-702d9802a373.title: Linear Programming

plus 600 h.   But we have some constraints, so the 
constraint says that there is no point   in producing more than 200 barfi boxes

buy because the daily demand is

70e07980-8ef3-4cd3-ac59-0e5a46e87e96.title: Linear Programming
70e07980-8ef3-4cd3-ac59-0e5a46e87e96.chunk:
at most 200. 
  Similarly, the daily demand for halwa is at 
most 300. So, there is no point in making   more than 300 boxes. Remember b and h are the 
quantities we are going to make in one day.   Then we also have this production constraint. 
Production

56f67d3a-26c0-4667-86eb-916c624e8ebc.title: Linear Programming
56f67d3a-26c0-4667-86eb-916c624e8ebc.chunk:
constraint says that, the staff as   a whole cannot make more than 400 boxes 
so the total amount of barfi plus halwa   put together cannot be more than 400.

wh

eb67f127-7d1b-4d1b-b038-42777a9e46fc.title: Linear Programming
eb67f127-7d1b-4d1b-b038-42777a9e46fc.chunk:
ich is that, we cannot make negative boxes of   barfis and negative boxes of always so at least we 
make can make 0 boxes of one of them. So, b must   be bigger than equal to 0 and h must be bigger 
than equal to 0. So, here we have the constraint.   These

358ed2ee-7e10-4b15-853e-960d64a7b573.title: Linear Programming
358ed2ee-7e10-4b15-853e-960d64a7b573.chunk:
are our constraints. We have an upper bound

now we have to write

our objective. So, our   objective is clearly to maximize our profit and

71f37014-91d2-4550-a275-1c78ec87eeba.title: Linear Programming

subject 
to these constraints. So, this is now the linear   program that we want to solve, we are given

are linear functions of our variables, now find   the optim

ed9c316f-1149-4535-9bbd-3eb575d79097.title: Linear Programming

um values of b and h given this.

So, the first constraint, this constraint tell

9ac00dfe-ccd7-4a23-98e2-0f608d3d233f.title: Linear Programming
9ac00dfe-ccd7-4a23-98e2-0f608d3d233f.chunk:
s   us that b must be less than or equal to 200. So, 
there is a line there indicating a boundary saying   that I should not go into this region at all

And

f85a77f6-b6cb-447b-8d05-13c894687f54.title: Linear Programming

similarly, there is a constraint on the halwa   boxes which says that the halwas should be no

becomes a line like this where b plus

ef102d2f-cba8-496a-b90e-ee866be0f238.chunk:
lines giving 
constraints saying that we must be above b equal   to 0 and we must be to the right of b equal to 0

of b and h which lies in this yellow

within this

feasible reason.

s

n, 100 b plus ch, 600 h and then we pick

that I get h

ere is 600 into 100 is 60,000.

xes. So, I get 180000 from my halwa   and I get 10,000 from my 100 barfi boxes. So,

0a18ce53-9870-4014-a792-6a4fe314d05a.title: Linear Programming
0a18ce53-9870-4014-a792-6a4fe314d05a.chunk:
ne interesting property about 
linear programs that you will find that the   optimum value will always lie at a vertex. 
So, if I draw this particular feasible region,   then what it means is the optimum value 
must be at one of these five points.   It can

5d896031-f1b9-453b-b135-a1cadd719d98.title: Linear Programming
5d896031-f1b9-453b-b135-a1cadd719d98.chunk:
not be anywhere else. It must be at some 
vertex in the polygon sense not in the graph   theoretic sense that we have been used to. But 
if you think of polygons and shapes, it is at   some vertex of this feasible region that we draw 
by inserting all our

b911a3d4-80de-4910-85f6-1ed0261c8f0d.title: Linear Programming
b911a3d4-80de-4910-85f6-1ed0261c8f0d.chunk:
constraints as lines. 
  So, there is a very classical algorithm 
which solves linear programs by exploiting   this observation. So, what you 
do is you start at any vertex,   so you first have to calculate of course that 
feasible region and once you calc

ce5cec92-8db2-4ce5-a983-58018061ae29.title: Linear Programming
ce5cec92-8db2-4ce5-a983-58018061ae29.chunk:
ulate that   feasible region you know where the vertices are 
which are all the corners in some sense of that   feasible region so you start at any one and 
then you evaluate the objective there. 
  And then once you evaluate your objective there, 
you loo

314c4279-05c8-4d02-8931-7d7d4582a4b7.title: Linear Programming
314c4279-05c8-4d02-8931-7d7d4582a4b7.chunk:
k at all the next nearby vertices, you look   at all the neighbouring vertices to the place 
where you started and if the objective improves   by going to any one of them, then you move. If the 
objective does not move then if the objective does   not impr

301f3a6b-8675-4675-b2c3-a91213ec3736.title: Linear Programming
301f3a6b-8675-4675-b2c3-a91213ec3736.chunk:
ove, then you stop. So, this is what is 
called simplex. So, you just start at a vertex   and try to find a vertex whose objective value 
is larger than all of its neighbours and you   can actually show that this is correct. 
Now the problem with this algo

ae8ad0ad-85e7-4409-9912-51a3119dcdf6.title: Linear Programming
ae8ad0ad-85e7-4409-9912-51a3119dcdf6.chunk:
rithm is that   it is not necessarily efficient. It can take an 
exponential amount of time but in most practical   problems like the kind of question that we raised 
with barfi and halwa, simplex actually works well   so this is quite often used in practi

a480c061-8a48-4aae-a9db-6cefec1abefd.title: Linear Programming
a480c061-8a48-4aae-a9db-6cefec1abefd.chunk:
ce as 
a solution for these linear programs.
  There are theoretically clever ways to solve 
linear programs which are provably efficient,   so you can actually do this in polynomial 
time but simplex is an easy thing to do   and it is what most people use

if they are

course the feasible region must exist.

convex, so convexit

y is a geometric property   so intuitively something like this is not convex

any 2 points inside the shape. And I draw them,   I draw a line connecting them. T

he entire line 
stays within the shape, so this is not convex   whereas this is convex because I take any

thing holds. So, if a polygon is convex,   it will look like t

his and if the polygon is 
not convex for example a typical thing will   have a kind of inward facing corner. So, the

And of course, the convex polygon may be   em

c4d90493-bf9d-4bad-b4d3-15a111b22967.title: Linear Programming

pty. So, there may be no constraint with

you cannot produce more than 40

0 together.

at 
the feasible region is actually empty that   you do not have a polygon does not have any

halwa and I only have an upper bound on my barfi,   then I say that my burfi will keep me here but I

on.
